msItem.note: Number of Miracles 8. The folios are misplaced, the text is in disorder. The right order of the miracles is: ff. 28ra-35vb, 36ra-36vb, 17ra-18vb, 37ra-37vb, 25ra-25vb, 38ra-38va. Folios missing between f. 35 and f. 36, with consequent part of the text missing

supportDesc.condition: Original binding missing; several folios are missing and many misplaced. Several folios are damaged at the edges (e.g. ff. 1, 3, 15, 40); some folios have holes (e.g. ff. 9, 20); f. 41 is of a shorter dimension; ff. 39v-41v have a very dark colour of the parchment.

seg.desc: The handwriting is quite uniform, characterized by right-sloping rounded letters, with broad and thick shapes. It shows ancient features: the letters መ, ወ, with angular loops, ዐ ፀ with a triangular shape, ሎ sometimes with the loop attached to the body of the letter (see e.g. f. 12rb, l. 16, f. 14rb l. 3); the numeral ፪ with the two loops attached (e.g, f. 13rb, l.17); the numerals sometimes without the dashes above and below (e.g. f. 14rb l. 15). Coronis, on f. 8r (intercolumn) at the end of text 1.1 (f. 24vb); paragraphs signs and cues (numerals) for rubrication (e.g. ff. 8v)
seg.seg: A few lines, alternating with black lines, on the incipit page of text 1.1 (f. 2r), of text 1.2 (f. 28r) and of miracle 8 in text 1.2 (f. 25r); 1-3 lines (sometimes alternating with black lines) on the incipit of the miracles 2, 3, 4, 6, 7; personal names in the supplication formulas; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; elements of the punctuation signs, paragraphs signs; coronis and/or their elements (f. 8r, f. 25va).

item.note: Recent hand; crudely written; black and red ink.
Crudely and recently written; black ink.

Written in black ink. The text on f. 39r is within any columns (f. 39r is without layout). The handwriting seems to be slightly different, but not so much recent than the main hand (in a smaller size).
Crudely and recently written (after Additio 3); black ink. The initial lines have been erased.

binding.decoNote: European cardboard binding, with two white paper leaves are at the front and back side, as protective leaves of the text block; recent textile inlays and sewing used as reinforcements of the quires; original boards and covers missing.
